instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Hello,

We have an A1707 that stoped working with no reason. It has no liquid damages or anything else... just stop working. The client reporta the following:

"For some time now, the computer disconnected almost all usb-c connections with the message that ?The USB accessory is consuming too much energy. The ports were turned off ?, which I imagine may have something to do with this event."

Here are the measurements I got:

PPBUS_G3H = 12.58V
PPBUS_HS_CPU = 12.58V
PPBUS_HS_GPU = 12.58V
PPBUS_HS_OTH5V = 12.58V
PPBUS_HS_OTH3V3 = 12.58V
PPBUS_S4_HS_TPAD = 12.58V
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 0V
PPVCCSA_S0_CPU = 0V
PPVCCGT_S0_CPU = 0V
PPVCCIO_S0_CPU = 0V
PP3V3_G3H = 3.4V
PP3V0_G3H = 3.0V
PP1V2_S3 = 0V
PP1V2_S3_CPUDDR = 0V
PP1V2_S0SW = 0V
PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT = 0V
PP0V6_S3_MEM_VREFD0_A = 0V
PP0V6_S3_MEM_VREFCA_A = 0V
PP0V6_S3_MEM_VREFD0_B = 0V
PP1V8_SUS = Fluctuates between 1.4V and 0.5V
PP1V8_S4 = 0V
PP1V8_S3 = 0V
PP1V8_S3_MEM = 0V
PP1V8_S0 = 0V
PP1V0_SUS = Fluctuates between 0.6V and 0V
PP1V0_S3 = 0V
PP1V0_S0SW = 0V
PP3V3_S5_T139 = Fluctuates between 0V and 3.3V
PP3V3_S4_SOC_PMU = 0V
PP5V_S0_T139 = Fluctuates between 1V and 0.5V
PP3V3_S5 = Fluctuates between 0V and 3.3V
PP3V3_SUS = 0V
PP3V3_S4 = 0V
PP5_S4 = 0V
PP5V_S0 = 0.5V
PP3V3_S4_T151 = 0V
PP3V3_S0 = Fluctuates between 0V and 0.5V
PP5V_S5 = Fluctuates between 0V and 5V

The resistance of the PP3V3_SUS = 3M Ohm
The resistance of the PP5V_S4 = 5M Ohm

Can anyone help?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum!

I don't see any reason for such a big listing.
If you miss a SUS voltage, no S4 possible; of course no S3 and S0 too.
In fact, even S5 is not stable in your case.

Let as know exact 820-xxxx board code...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Thank you @2informaticos.
The board code is 820-00281-A

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Thank you @2informaticos.
The board code is 820-00281-A

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Thank you @2informaticos.
The board code is 820-00281-A

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Please, maintain forum aestethic.
Do not comment; always better to write new post.

Check for stable level at PP3V3_PMICLDO, PP1V25_PMICVREF, PP3V0_G3H and the 3 RTC signals (page 12).

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Hello, sorry for the aestethic. I?m new in the forums...

PP3V3_PMICLDO = 3.29V stable
PP1V25_PMICVREF = 1.24V Stable
PP3V0_G3H = 3V Stable

Related to the RTC Sgnals, I don't have an oscilloscope. Is there any other way to diagnose?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
No need of an o-scope.
I was refering to 3 DC signals, RTC_RESET_L, PCH_SRTCRST_L, PCH_INTRUDER_L...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
OK, miss understood.

RTC_RESET_L = 3V

PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3V

PCH_INTRUDER_L = 2.8V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Are you sure no pulse at all at PM_SLP_S5_L?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Yes, PM_SLP_S5_L fluctuates between 0 and 0.2

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and see if you catch higger peak value on the fluctuating signals and voltages.

Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
I?m not sure if I understood what you mean but in the SMC_ONOFF_L, mesured at the R4911 I?ve got a steady 3.4V.
Related to start in SMC bypass mode, I don't know how to do it. Can you please explain it to me?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: I guess that you're talking about what I know as smc reset (10 seconds on power off button). If so, I already did it.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
"Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L"
As you have to work with board alone on the desk, use SW5200, or R5226 pads, instead of power button.
In fact, solder an wire on SMC_ONOFF_L and touch any metal plate (temporary contact), simulating power button.

"SMC bypass mode"
Put SMC_ONOFF_L to ground, connect charger, maintain contact 5-10s; board should start when you release SMC_ONOFF_L.

Remember to work with board alone, nothing connected apart of charger (no battery).

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Thanks for the explanation 2informaticos. I?ve done SMC bypass mode, but with no sucess. Still no boot.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L repeatedly and check for reaction (pulse) at all PM_SLP_Sx_L; at same time as simulating power button.
First, be sure to get a drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: I dont get a drop pulse on PM_PWRBTN_L because it is continous flutoating betewn 3.4 and 0V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Sorry, I forgot that 3V3_S5 fluctuates...
Remove R7663 and check if stable.
If yes, then check PM_PWRBTN_L reaction.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: After removing the R7663, the 3V3_S5 continus to fluctuate. The PM_PWRBTN_L stays the same

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Remove R7643 too and see if SMC_PM_G2_EN is stable now; keep R7663 removed.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Hello, yes, SMC_PM_G2_EN is stable now. 3.4V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Looks like SMC detects a problem in S5 state and cycles SMC_PM_G2_EN.
Check what happens trying to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: I already did it. Nothing appends. it starts with 0.12 A and drops to 0A. them start again... 0.12A and 0A. It keeps trying to boot, I think

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Do you have now stable 3V3_S5/SUS voltages?
With R7643/63 both removed...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: No I dont't. They keep dropping

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Post some U7650 voltages in this case; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
U7650 Voltages:

PIN 12 = fluctuates between 3.4V nd 0V
PIN 13 = fluctuates between 3V and 0V
PIN 22 = 3.297V
PIN 23 = 12.58V
PIN 29 = fluctuates between 3.8V and 0V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Can you help me?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
You should have a problem with SMC, or U7800.

Remove R8110 and run a tiny wire from C7653 to C7644.
Se if you get stable 3V3_S5.
If yes, try soldering R7663.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Hi,
just to be sure...

I removed the R8110 and now the 3V3_S5  is 0V.
There is no C7644 (no stuf) and the C7653 is 3.298V. 
now, on  the pad of the R811, i have 3.4V on SMC_PM_G2_EN and 0V on PM_EM_PVXS5. 
Do you still want me to jumper both of them?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Yes, just for test...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: OK, but from pin 1 to pin 1 and pin 2 to pin 2 of the C7644 and C7653?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Why do you bother about ground pins?
Don't you have connection there???

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: It was just to be sure. I want to follow your instructions precisely

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
You must be able to follow a schematic man.
Use the logic, please.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
I´ll try it... 
After removing C7653 and jumping them both, i have 0V in PP3V3_S5

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
"After removing C7653 "
Why did that???
You just need to remove R8110 and inject P5VP3V3_VREG3 to PM_EN_PVXS5.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Sorry, it was distraction...

After soldering C7653 back, both P5VP3V3_VREG3  and PM_EN_PVXS5  has 3.5V, but PP3V3_S5  has 0V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Post again (mentioned) U7650 voltages, in this configuration...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Follow schematic and try to understand what I've asked you to do.
Pins 12 and 22 must have the same voltage...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Well, after soldering back R8110 and R7663 i get the following in U7650:

PIN 12 =  3.3V
PIN 13 =  1.9V
PIN 22 = 3.6V
PIN 23 = 12.5V
PIN 29 = 05.1V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
All these stable?
You should try to resolder R7643 too now.
Do you resolder R8110 and still keep the mentioned wire between C7653 and PM_EN_PVXS5???

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Yes, i´ve already solder R7643, and the voltages are all stable.
No, i removed the jumper in C7653

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: So you have steady SMC_PM_G2_EN, with R8110 and both R7643/63 in place?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Yes, SMC_PM_G2_EN  is steay at 3.3V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Then you should have 3V at pin 21/U7650 too.
And 3V3_S5 should be present at L7660.

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Well, right now it seams to be dead. Out of the blue, over night, it died.
Now in the USB amp it takes 4.98V and 0.14 mA

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
SMC_PM_G2_EN fluctuates again?
You can have problems with SMC, or U7800...

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: It doesn´t fluctuate. It's 0V

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message: Do you get correct 3V3_G3H and PPBUS_G3H now?

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
Hello,
No. We have 0V in both 3V3_G3H and PPBUS_G3H.
On the ampmeter it is pulling only 4.97V and 0.13A

threads.title: A1707 not powering on
threads.message:
0.13A is high current in this conditions.
Do you get voltage at R7020?
Check LDO outputs of all CD3215 chips also.
